text:
Chrissy Teigen wasn't invited to Emily Ratajkowski's surprise wedding , and the queen of comments has something to say about it.

Yesterday, model and actress Emily Ratajkowski tied the knot in a small courthouse wedding with now-husband actor and producer Sebastian Bear-McClard in New York City , revealing the news in a cheeky Instagram post of the newlyweds captioned, "💍ny💍." The news has come has a particular shock to fans and celebs alike, some who were unaware the two were even in a serious relationship.

Loading View on Instagram

But leave it to Chrissy Teigen to have something to say about the wedding. The model took to Twitter to express her feelings, and you'll love her very Chrissy-esque response to her lack of an invitation.

"I'm oddly mad I wasn't invited to @emrata's wedding even though we barely speak..." she tweeted on Friday. "Like, I like all your photos and leave flames on some."

"@emrata ALSO, CONGRATS!!" she added, with a handful of fire emojis—so it seems that all is well with their relationship.

The new bride posted a series of snaps to Instagram Stories sharing the news in addition to her Instagram post. "Soooo I have a surprise. I got married today," she wrote. Instead of wearing traditional bridal whites, Ratajkowski donned for an orange monochromatic trench and wide-leg pants and a black hat with delicate veil.

See more: Chrissy Teigen's Throwback Proves She and John Legend Were Always the Coolest Couple at the Grammy Awards

The two didn't share much about their special day, but it was revealed that their guest list did include Instagram personality The Fat Jewish (aka Josh Ostrovsky). Bear-McClard is a producer who is best known for his crime drama movie Good Time , starring Robert Pattinson. He also appeared as an actor in the 2006 film The Minority .
title: Chrissy Teigen Is "Oddly Mad" She Wasn't Invited to Emily Ratajkowski's Wedding
